All Rights Reserved</copyright><language>en_US</language><lastBuildDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:11:34 EDT</lastBuildDate><item><title>Connor Carrick and Connor Brown lead Marlies past Devils 5-1 in AHL playoffs</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882555</link><description>
ALBANY, N.Y. - Connor Carrick and Connor Brown had back-to-back power-play goals as the Toronto Marlies beat the Albany Devils 5-1 on Thursday in the American Hockey League Eastern conference semifinal.

Toronto now leads the best-of-seven ser...</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:35:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882555</guid></item><item><title>Rouyn-Noranda Huskies win first-ever Quebec Major Junior Hockey League title</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882579</link><description>
ROUYN-NORANDA, Que. - The Rouyn-Noranda Huskies are the new Quebec Major Junior Hockey League champions.

Martins Dzierkals scored twice, including the eventual winner, as the Rouyn-Noranda Huskies routed the Shawinigan Cataractes 7-2 on Thurs...</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:04:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882579</guid></item><item><title>Devils' Patrik Elias, Cory Schneider both undergo surgery</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882554</link><description>
NEWARK, N.J. - The New Jersey Devils say forward Patrik Elias and goalie Cory Schneider had surgeries earlier this week.

The Devils say Elias had surgery on his right knee on Wednesday at the Hospital for Special Surgery in New York. Elias, a...</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:25:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882554</guid></item><item><title>Chayka could become trendsetter as young NHL GM; MLB already flooded with youth</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882368</link><description>
Recently named the youngest general manager in NHL history, John Chayka of the Arizona Coyotes may represent the start of a trend toward youth in hockey. Major League Baseball has fully embraced youth in the GM's chair since Theo Epstein was hir...</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:25:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882368</guid></item><item><title>Coyotes 26-year-old GM could start trend of young thinkers in senior NHL roles</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882367</link><description>
David Simpson opened the newspaper last week and read that John Chayka had become the youngest general manager in NHL history.

"Huh," Simpson said to his wife, "I know this guy."

No, she responded in disbelief.

"Yeah," said Simpson, the...</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:15:01 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882367</guid></item><item><title>WHL Roundup: Thunderbirds down Wheat Kings 6-1 in Game 5 of playoff series</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882410</link><description>
KENT, Wash. - Alexander True had back-to-back goals in the second period â including the eventual winner â as the Seattle Thunderbirds downed the Brandon Wheat Kings 6-1 on Wednesday in Western Hockey League playoff action.

Brandon leads the ...</description><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 01:24:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882410</guid></item><item><title>Buffalo Sabres home arena changing names to KeyBank Center</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882359</link><description>
BUFFALO, N.Y. - The Buffalo Sabres home arena is undergoing yet another name change, and will soon be referred to as KeyBank Center.

Sabres President Russ Brandon announced the pending change on Wednesday after federal regulators approved Key...</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 19:25:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882359</guid></item><item><title>Trio of Kessel, Hagelin and Bonino leading way for Penguins</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882358</link><description>
PITTSBURGH, Pa. - The line that sent the Pittsburgh Penguins full throttle into the Eastern Conference finals wasn't even on the roster a year ago.

Phil Kessel was stuck in Toronto, where his undeniable talent but occasionally questionable co...</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 17:15:01 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882358</guid></item><item><title>Hockey Canada wants fewer empty seats at Bell Centre for 2017 world juniors</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882400</link><description>
MONTREAL - The empty seats at the Bell Centre for the 2015 world junior hockey championship were not forgotten when Hockey Canada put tickets on sale for the 2017 event this week.

There is a wider variety of options and some lower prices on t...</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 16:14:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882400</guid></item><item><title>Blackhawks agree to 3-year deal with D Gustav Forsling</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882357</link><description>
CHICAGO - The Chicago Blackhawks and 19-year-old defenceman Gustav Forsling have agreed to a three-year contract.

The Blackhawks announced the contract Wednesday.

Forsling had six goals and 15 assists in 48 games last season for Linkoping ...</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 15:55:01 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882357</guid></item><item><title>Blues go with goalie Brian Elliott as starter for Game 7</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882356</link><description>
DALLAS - Brian Elliott will start in goal for the St. Louis Blues in Game 7 of the Western Conference finals against the Dallas Stars on Wednesday night.

Coach Ken Hitchcock held off naming a starter until after the morning skate, several hou...</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 14:55:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882356</guid></item><item><title>Mike Johnston returns to WHL's Portland Winter Hawks as coach and GM</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882397</link><description>
PORTLAND, Ore. - The Portland Winterhawks have brought back Mike Johnston as coach and general manager of the Western Hockey League team.

Johnston previously held the same positions with the Winterhawks from 2008 to 2014, before taking over a...</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 14:14:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882397</guid></item><item><title>Former NHL coach of the year Crawford ready to accept assistant role in Ottawa</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882355</link><description>
OTTAWA - Marc Crawford just wanted to be back in the NHL.

A former NHL coach of the year who spent the last four seasons coaching in Switzerland, Crawford was one of a number of candidates interviewed for the opening with the Ottawa Senators ...</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 13:35:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882355</guid></item><item><title>Finland takes top spot in world group after beating Hungary</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882354</link><description>
ST. PETERSBURG, Russia - Two Slovakian players were sent to hospital Wednesday at the world hockey championship, one with a broken leg, following a 4-2 loss to Belarus.

Defenceman Michal Sersen was stretchered off in the third period when his...</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 12:45:01 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882354</guid></item><item><title>Wheat Kings beat Thunderbirds in overtime, one win away from sweeping finals</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882277</link><description>
KENT, Wash. - Reid Duke scored 2:59 into overtime as the Brandon Wheat Kings beat the Seattle Thunderbirds 3-2 on Tuesday to move one win away from becoming the Western Hockey League champions.

John Quenneville struck twice in regulation for ...</description><pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 02:34:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882277</guid></item><item><title>AHL board approves sale, relocation of Coyotes' affililate</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882144</link><description>
CHICAGO - The American Hockey League board of governors has granted conditional approval to the Arizona Coyotes to buy the Springfield Falcons and relocate the franchise to Tucson, Arizona.

The board unanimously approved the sale and move at ...</description><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 19:05:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882144</guid></item><item><title>Erie Otters' Kris Knoblauch wins Ontario Hockey League coach of the year</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882166</link><description>
TORONTO - Kris Knoblauch of the Erie Otters won the Matt Leyden Trophy on Tuesday as the Ontario Hockey League's coach of the year.

Knoblauch guided the Otters to an OHL-best 52-15-1-0 record, earning a second straight Midwest Division crown ...</description><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 17:34:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882166</guid></item><item><title>Red Wings hire assistant coach Houda, don't re-sign Bedard</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882142</link><description>
DETROIT - The Detroit Red Wings hired assistant coach Doug Houda on Tuesday after agreeing to a three-year contract.

Houda was drafted by Detroit in 1984 and was one of its defencemen for parts of six seasons. He had been a Boston Bruins assi...</description><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 16:15:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882142</guid></item><item><title>Today's stars evidence of NHL's ongoing struggle to project goaltending</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882141</link><description>
The Atlanta Thrashers liked a lot about Kari Lehtonen when they picked him second overall in 2002.

They liked his winning credentials in the Finnish league, loved his six foot four frame and judged him to be a quality goaltender.

Now playi...</description><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 14:45:01 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882141</guid></item><item><title>'The Goldbergs' creator talks love affair with Flyers</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882140</link><description>
PHILADELPHIA - Barry Goldberg has come to say goodbye to a close-knit friend at a Flyers funeral. Resting in a box were the tattered remains of Goldberg's cherished Philadelphia Flyers T-shirt he named Big Orange.

"All my greatest memories we...</description><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 14:35:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882140</guid></item><item><title>Danish player at hockey worlds taken to hospital</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882139</link><description>
ST. PETERSBURG, Russia - Germany moved into fourth place in Group B at the hockey world championship by beating Slovakia 5-1 Tuesday.

Dominik Kahun and Philip Gogulla each had a goal and an assist each as Germany won its first game of the tou...</description><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 12:15:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882139</guid></item><item><title>NHL Playoff Capsules</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882137</link><description>
NASHVILLE, Tenn. - Viktor Arvidsson scored 2:03 into overtime, and the Nashville Predators forced a deciding seventh game for their second straight series by beating the San Jose Sharks 4-3 on Monday night.

Arvidsson jumped the puck between t...</description><pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 00:25:01 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882137</guid></item><item><title>Predators force another Game 7 by beating Sharks 4-3 in OT</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882136</link><description>

Ross Robertson Cup</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882153</link><description>
ST. CATHARINES, Ont. - The Niagara IceDogs let one slip away.

Owen MacDonald scored at 2:58 of overtime as the London Knights came from behind for a 6-5 win over the host IceDogs on Monday in Game 3 of the Ontario Hockey League final.

Niag...</description><pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 22:14:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=882153</guid></item><item><title>Florida Panthers, Erik Gudbranson agree on 1-year deal</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881932</link><description>
SUNRISE, Fla. - The Florida Panthers and defenceman Erik Gudbranson have agreed on a one-year contract.

The Panthers announced the deal on Monday. Panthers general manager Dale Tallon says Gudbranson is an "important part of our young core."...</description><pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 16:55:02 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881932</guid></item><item><title>Oilers sign forward Patrick Russell to two-year entry-level contract</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881929</link><description>
EDMONTON - The Edmonton Oilers have signed forward Patrick Russell to a two-year entry-level contract.

The 23-year-old Russell appeared in 41 games this season with the NCAA's St. Cloud State Huskies, posting career highs 41 in goals (20), as...</description><pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 14:15:01 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881929</guid></item><item><title>O'Reilly scores twice as Canada routs Belarus 8-0 at hockey world championship</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881928</link><description>
ST. PETERSBURG, Russia - Ryan O'Reilly scored twice as Canada remained unbeaten at the world hockey championship with an 8-0 rout of Belarus on Monday.

Canada broke a close game open with four second-period goals to improve to 3-0 in St. Pete...</description><pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2016 11:55:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881928</guid></item><item><title>QMJHL Roundup: Greer scores early in third, Rouyn-Noranda downs Shawinigan in Game 3</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881986</link><description>
SHAWINIGAN, Que. - The Rouyn-Noranda Huskies are a win away from claiming the President Cup.

Anthony-John Greer scored the go-ahead goal at 3:46 of the third period as Rouyn-Noranda downed the Shawinigan Cataractes 2-1 on Sunday in Game 3 of ...</description><pubDate>Sun, 08 May 2016 22:24:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881986</guid></item><item><title>Canadiens sign forward Artturi Lehkonen to three-year contract</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881923</link><description>
MONTREAL - The Montreal Canadiens signed forward Artturi Lehkonen to a three-year, two-way contact on Sunday.

The 20-year-old Finland native scored 16 goals and 17 assists in 49 games this season with HC Frolunda of the Swedish Elite League....</description><pubDate>Sun, 08 May 2016 17:15:01 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881923</guid></item><item><title>Guy Boucher named new head coach of the Ottawa Senators</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881921</link><description>
OTTAWA - Guy Boucher has been hired as the new head coach of the Ottawa Senators.

The 44-year-old Boucher becomes the 12th head coach in Senators franchise history, replacing Dave Cameron who was fired on April 12.

Boucher has spent parts ...</description><pubDate>Sun, 08 May 2016 13:25:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881921</guid></item><item><title>Four goals in 2nd period fuel 7-1 Canada win over Hungary at wockey worlds</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881920</link><description>
ST. PETERSBURG, Russia - Four goals in the span of 5:33 midway through the second period fuelled a 7-1 win for Team Canada over a determined Hungarian squad on Sunday at the world hockey championships in Russia.

Canada is now 2-0 in St. Peter...</description><pubDate>Sun, 08 May 2016 08:05:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881920</guid></item><item><title>Lightning: This is no time for letdown against Islanders</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881919</link><description>
TAMPA, Fla. - The Tampa Bay Lightning are one victory away from reaching the Eastern Conference finals for the second straight year, and they know it won't be easy to close out their second-round playoff series against the New York Islanders.
...</description><pubDate>Sun, 08 May 2016 01:55:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881919</guid></item><item><title>WHL Roundup: Hawryluk nets OT winner, Wheat Kings beat Thunderbirds in Game 2</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881973</link><description>
BRANDON, Man. - Jayce Hawryluk scored the winner at 6:56 of overtime on Saturday as the Brandon Wheat Kings edged the Seattle Thunderbirds 3-2 in Game 2 of their Western Hockey League final to take a 2-0 series lead.

Tyler Coulter tied the ga...</description><pubDate>Sun, 08 May 2016 00:04:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881973</guid></item><item><title>OHL Roundup: Tkachuk dominates as Knights beat IceDogs for 2-0 series lead</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881852</link><description>
LONDON, Ont. - Matthew Tkachuk scored a hat trick and had an assist as the London Knights cruised to a 6-1 victory over the Niagara IceDogs Saturday night in Game 2 of their Ontario Hockey League final series.

Christian Dvorak added a goal an...</description><pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2016 22:44:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881852</guid></item><item><title>Lightning: This is no time for letdown against Islanders</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881914</link><description>
TAMPA, Fla. - The Tampa Bay Lightning are one victory away from reaching the Eastern Conference finals for the second straight year, and they know it won't be easy to close out their second-round playoff series against the New York Islanders.
...</description><pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2016 19:15:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881914</guid></item><item><title>QMJHL Roundup: Greer scores twice, Huskies eventually beat Cataractes in Game 2</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881847</link><description>
ROUYN-NORANDA, Que. - Anthony-John Greer scored twice as the Rouyn-Noranda Huskies picked up where they left off with a 4-1 victory over the Shawinigan Cataractes on Saturday in Game 2 of their Quebec Major Junior Hockey League final series.

...</description><pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2016 18:34:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881847</guid></item><item><title>Oilers sign collegiate forward Drake Caggiula to entry-level deal</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881752</link><description>
EDMONTON - Highly touted collegiate star Drake Caggiula was signed to a two-year entry level contract on Saturday by the Edmonton Oilers.

Caggiula appeared in 39 games this season with the University of North Dakota in the National Collegiate...</description><pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2016 14:15:01 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881752</guid></item><item><title>Crosby, Benn and Kane named Hart Trophy finalists as NHL's most valuable player</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881751</link><description>
NEW YORK, N.Y. - Pittsburgh's Sidney Crosby, Dallas's Jamie Benn and Chicago's Patrick Kane were named the finalists for the Hart Memorial Trophy on Saturday, awarded to the NHL's most valuable player.

Crosby finished third in the NHL with 36...</description><pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2016 13:35:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881751</guid></item><item><title>WHL Roundup: Kaspick scores in OT, Brandon downs Seattle to open final</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881842</link><description>
BRANDON, Man. - Tanner Kaspick scored 6:22 into overtime as the Brandon Wheat Kings downed the Seattle Thunderbirds 3-2 on Friday to open the Western Hockey League final.

Reid Duke and Nolan Patrick also scored for the Wheat Kings, who are pl...</description><pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2016 00:54:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881842</guid></item><item><title>QMJHL Roundup: Game 2 of President Cup postponed after water leak</title><link>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881839</link><description>
ROUYN-NORANDA, Que. - The second game of the Quebec Major Junior Hockey League final will have to wait until Saturday to be concluded.

Game 2 between the Shawinigan Cataractes and the host Rouyn-Noranda Huskies had to be postponed on Friday d...</description><pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2016 00:14:00 EDT</pubDate><guid>http://www.nhl.com/ice/news.htm?id=881839</guid></item></channel></rss>
